question: Will the Hornets beat the Magic by more than 5.5 points in their October 27th matchup?
description:
In the upcoming NBA game:

If the Charlotte Hornets win by over 5.5 points, the market will resolve to “Yes”.

If the Orlando Magic lose by less than 5.5 points or win, the market will resolve “No.” 

If the game is not completed by November 3, 2021, the market will resolve 50-50.

question: 2021 World Series: Who will win Braves v. Astros Game 2 on October 27th?
description:
In the MLB 2021 World Series Game 2:

If the Atlanta Braves win, the market will resolve to “Braves.” 

If the Houston Astros win, the market will resolve to “Astros.” 

If the game is not completed by November 4, 2021, the market will resolve 48-52 favoring “Astros.”

----------------------------------------------

The 2021 World Series is the championship series of Major League Baseball's (MLB) 2021 season. 
The 117th edition of the World Series is a best-of-seven playoff played between the National League (NL) champion Atlanta Braves and the American League (AL) champion Houston Astros. 

The series is began on October 26, currently 1-0 in favour of the Atlanta Braves, with a potential Game 7 scheduled for November 3.

question: Will 18 million Americans have received at least one 'booster shot' of the COVID-19 vaccine by November 4th?
description:
This is a market on the number of people in The United States of America who have received at least one 'booster shot' of an approved COVID-19 vaccine, according to the CDC COVID tracker, by the resolution date, November 4, 2021, 9:00 PM ET. 

This market will resolve to "Yes" if 18,000,000 or more people received a booster dose by the resolution date, and "No" otherwise.

The resolution source for this market will be the official data published by the CDC available at https://covid.cdc.gov/covid-data-tracker/#vaccinations_vacc-total-admin-rate-total, in the box with text "People received a booster dose," and will be checked at the resolution time/date. If the website is down, the most recently available data will be used to resolve the market. If the website is not down, this market will resolve according to the data as available immediately at the time of resolution, and resolution will not be delayed for the purpose of waiting for updated data from a specific date. 

-----------------------------------------

COVID Data Tracker counts people as "Fully Vaccinated with a Booster Dose" if they are fully vaccinated and have received another dose of COVID-19 vaccine since August 13, 2021. This includes people who received booster doses and people who received additional doses.

COVID Data Tracker counts people as being “Fully Vaccinated” if they received two doses on different days (regardless of time interval) of the two-dose mRNA series or received one dose of a single-dose vaccine.

question: Will the 7-day COVID-19 case average in the UK be greater than 44,000 on November 8?
description:
This is a market on the 7-day COVID-19 case average (people who have had at least one positive COVID-19 test result) in the United Kingdom, by date reported, for the day of November 8, 2021. 

This market will resolve to "Yes", if the 7-Day average for daily COVID-19 cases count in United Kingdom is greater than 44,000 for the day of November 8, and "No" otherwise. The resolution source for this market will be https://coronavirus.data.gov.uk/details/cases. 

The 7-day moving average for the day of November 8 will be checked at 8:00 PM ET on November 12, 2021. If data for the day of November 8 is not accessible, the resolution source will be checked every 24 hours until it is available. If the data is still unavailable by November 15th, the market will resolve based on the most recent 7-Day Moving Average prior to November 8.

Please note that the 7-day moving average for any particular date is counted as an average of daily counts for this day, previous three days, and next three days, thus the resolution data for this market will be checked on November 12. Note also, that if the average equals 44,000, this market will resolve to "No".
